installer.initial_account_will_be_administrator_au: The initial account will be administrator automatically.

breaking_changes.v346_using_basic_auth: Basic Authentication currently in use will no longer be available in the near future. Remove settings from %s

notice.restricted_defail: Once the admin approves your sign up, you'll be able to access this wiki.

form_help.email: You must have email address which listed below to sign up to this wiki.
form_help.password: Your password must be at least 6 characters long.
form_help.user_id: The URL of pages you create will contain your User ID. Your User ID can consist of letters, numbers, and some symbols.

form_help.profile_image2: Set up AWS or enable local uploads.

notice.update_token1: You can update to generate a new API Token.
notice.update_token2: You will need to update the API Token in any existing processes.

and.desc: Search pages that include both {{word1}}, {{word2}} in the title or body

exclude.desc: Exclude pages that include {{word}} in the title or body

phrase.desc: Search pages that include the phrase "{{phrase}}"

prefix.desc: Search only the pages that the title start with {{path}}

exclude_prefix.desc: Exclude the pages that the title start with {{path}}

notice.version: This is not the current version.
notice.unlinked: Redirect pages to this page have been deleted.
notice.restricted: Access to this page is restricted
notice.stale: More than {{count}} year has passed since last update.
notice.stale_plural: More than {{count}} years has passed since last update.

page_edit.overwrite_scopes: {{operation}} and Overwrite scopes of all descendants

notice.conflict: Couldn't save the changes you made because someone else was editing this page. Please re-edit the affected section after reloading the page.

page_api_error.notfound_or_forbidden: Original page is not found or forbidden.
page_api_error.outdated: Page is updated someone and now outdated.
page_api_error.user_not_admin: Only admin user can delete completely

help.redirect: Redirect to new page if someone accesses %s
help.metadata: Remains last update user and updated date as is

modal_delete.delete_completely_restriction: You don't have the authority to delete pages completely.
modal_delete.completely: Delete completely instead of putting it into trash.

help.recursively: Put Back children of under %s recursively

children.label: Template for children
children.desc: Applies only to the same level pages which the template exists

security_setting.Fixed by env var: This is fixed by the env var %s=%s.
security_setting.Register limitation desc: Restricts ways to register new user.
security_setting.The whitelist of registration permission: The whitelist of registration permission E-mail address
security_setting.users_without_account: Users without account is not accessible
security_setting.restrict_emails: You can restrict registerable e-mail address.
security_setting.for_instance: For instance, if you use growi within a company, you can write
security_setting.only_those: Only those whose e-mail address including the company address can register.
security_setting.insert_single: Please insert single e-mail address per line.
security_setting.page_listing_1_desc: Show pages that are restricted by 'Just Me' option when listing/searching
security_setting.page_listing_2_desc: Show pages that are restricted by User Group when listing/searching
security_setting.complete_deletion_explain: Restricts users who can completely delete pages.
security_setting.alert_siteUrl_is_not_set: 'Site URL' is NOT set. Set it from the {{link}}
security_setting.desc_of_callback_URL: Use it in the setting of the {{AuthName}} Identity provider
security_setting.Treat username matching as identical: Automatically bind external accounts newly logged in to local accounts when username match
security_setting.Treat username matching as identical_war: WARNING: Be aware of security because the system treats the same user as a match of username.
security_setting.Treat email matching as identical: Automatically bind external accounts newly logged in to local accounts when email match
security_setting.Treat email matching as identical_warn: WARNING: Be aware of security because the system treats the same user as a match of email.
security_setting.Use default if both are empty: If both ​​are empty, the default value {{target}} is used.
security_setting.missing mandatory configs: The following mandatory items are not set in either database nor environment variables.

ldap.server_url_detail: The LDAP URL of the directory service in the format ldap://host:port/DN or ldaps://host:port/DN.
ldap.bind_DN_manager_detail: The DN of the account that authenticates and queries the directory service
ldap.bind_DN_user_detail1: The query used to bind with the directory service.
ldap.bind_DN_user_detail2: Use {{username}} to reference the username entered in the login page.
ldap.bind_DN_password_manager_detail: The password for the Bind DN account.
ldap.bind_DN_password_user_detail: The password that is entered in the login page will be used to bind.
ldap.search_filter_detail1: The query used to locate the authenticated user.
ldap.search_filter_detail2: Use {{username}} to reference the username entered in the login page.
ldap.search_filter_detail3: If empty, the filter (uid={{username}}) is used.
ldap.username_detail: Specification of mappings for username when creating new users
ldap.name_detail: Specification of mappings for full name when creating new users
ldap.mail_detail: Specification of mappings for mail address when creating new users
ldap.group_search_base_DN_detail: The base DN from which to search for groups. If defined, also Group Search Filter must be defined for the search to work.
ldap.group_search_filter_detail1: The query used to filter for groups.
ldap.group_search_filter_detail2: Login via LDAP is accepted only when this query hits one or more groups.
ldap.group_search_filter_detail3: Use {{dn}} to have it replaced of the found user object.
ldap.group_search_filter_detail4: (&(cn=group1)(memberUid={{dn}})) hits the groups which has cn=group1 and memberUid includes the user's uid(when Group DN Property is not changed from the default value.)
ldap.group_search_user_DN_property_detail: The property of user object to use in {{dn}} interpolation of Group Search Filter.

SAML.name: SAML
SAML.id_detail: Specification of the name of attribute which can identify the user in SAML Identity Provider
SAML.username_detail: Specification of mappings for username when creating new users
SAML.mapping_detail: Specification of mappings for {{target}} when creating new users
SAML.cert_detail: PEM-encoded X.509 signing certificate to validate the response from IdP
SAML.Use env var if empty: If the value in the database is empty, the value of the environment variable {{env}} is used.
SAML.note for the only env option:
The setting item that enables or disables the SAML authentication and the highlighted setting items use only the value of environment variables.
To change this setting, please change to false or delete the value of the environment variable %s .
SAML.attr_based_login_control_detail: Limit who can sign up by using <saml: Attribute> element included in <saml: AttributeStatement> element and its child element <saml: AttributeValue>.
SAML.attr_based_login_control_rule_detail:
See Apache Lucene - Query Parser Syntax.
Supported Queries:
  • Terms
  • Fields
  • AND/NOT/OR Operator
  • Grouping
Unsupported Queries:
  • Wildcard, Fuzzy, Proximity, Range and Boosting
  • +/- Operator
  • Field Grouping
SAML.attr_based_login_control_rule_example:
Example
If a rule is (Department: A || Department: B) && Position: Leader, users who have either Department: A or Department: B and have Position: Leader can sign in.

Basic.name: Basic Authentication
Basic.desc_2: User will be automatically generated if not exist.

OAuth.change_redirect_url:
Enter %s
(where %s is your host name) for "Authorized redirect URIs".

Google.name: Google OAuth
Google.register_2: Create Project if no projects exist
Google.register_3: Create Credentials → OAuth client ID → Select "Web application"
Google.register_4: Register your OAuth App with one of Authorized redirect URIs as {{url}}
Google.register_5: Copy and paste your ClientID and Client Secret above
Google.updated_google: Succeeded to update Google OAuth setting

Twitter.name: Twitter OAuth
Twitter.register_3: Create Credentials → OAuth client ID → Select "Web application"
Twitter.register_4: Register your OAuth App with one of Authorized redirect URIs as {{url}}
Twitter.register_5: Copy and paste your ClientID and Client Secret above
Twitter.updated_twitter: Succeeded to update Twitter OAuth setting

GitHub.name: GitHub OAuth
GitHub.register_2: Register your OAuth App with "Authorization callback URL" as {{url}}
GitHub.register_3: Copy and paste your ClientID and Client Secret above
GitHub.updated_github: Succeeded to update GitHub OAuth setting

OIDC.name: OpenID Connect
OIDC.id_detail: Specification of the name of attribute which can identify the user in OIDC claims
OIDC.username_detail: Specification of mappings for username when creating new users
OIDC.name_detail: Specification of mappings for name when creating new users
OIDC.mapping_detail: Specification of mappings for %s when creating new users
OIDC.register_2: Register your OIDC App with "Authorization callback URL" as %s
OIDC.register_3: Copy and paste your ClientID and Client Secret above

notification_setting.prioritize_webhook: Prioritize Incoming Webhook than Slack App
notification_setting.prioritize_webhook_desc: Check this option and GROWI use Incoming Webhooks even if Slack App settings are enabled.
notification_setting.slack_app_configuration_desc:
This is the way that compatible with Crowi,
but not recommended in GROWI because it is too complex.
notification_setting.use_instead: Please use Slack Incoming Webhooks Configuration instead.

how_to.workspace_desc1: Go to Incoming Webhooks Configuration page.
how_to.workspace_desc2: Choose the default channel to post.
how_to.at_growi: (At GROWI admin page) Set Webhook URL
how_to.at_growi_desc: Input ”Webhook URL” and submit on this page.

notification_setting.pattern_desc: Path name of wiki. Pattern expression with * can be used.

email.ifttt_link: Create a new IFTTT applet with Email trigger

notification_setting.updated_slackApp: Succeeded to update Slack App Configuration setting
notification_setting.delete_notification_pattern_desc2: Once deleted, it cannot be recovered

full_text_search_management.reconnect_description: Click the button to try to reconnect to Elasticsearch.
full_text_search_management.normalize_description: Click the button to repair broken indices.
full_text_search_management.rebuild_description_1: Click the button to rebuild index and add all page datas.

export_management.desc_password_seed:
DO NOT FORGET to set current PASSWORD_SEED to your new GROWI system when restoring user data, or users will NOT be able to login with their password.

HINT:
The current PASSWORD_SEED will be stored in meta.json in exported ZIP.
